content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[!, :ym] = string.(Date.(df.dt), format=:yyyyMM)
end
```
This function uses the `Date` constructor to convert the `dt` column in `df` to a Date object, and then extracts the year and month from the resulting dates using the `format=:yyyyMM` option. The extracted values are then concatenated together as a string using the `string` function, and assigned to the new `ym` column in `df`.

To use this function, you can call it on your DataFrame like this:
```
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will create a new column `ym` in `df`, containing strings of the form "yyyymm".
